page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: {INTRODUCTION } Brynmawr, Nantyglo and Ebbw Vale form part of the Borough of Blaenau Gwent which is situated at the Northern edge of Western Gwent, conterminous with Powys.The rim of the South Wales coal field surfaces here.It was the availability of coal,iron ore and limestone here which led to the establishing of local iron making. This area which straddles the Heads of the Valleys Road is largely residential but does still have a number of small hill farms for the rearing of sheep,cattle and horses; the moorland to the north of the district being grazing land held in common by the local hill farmers. Average rainfall-64inches. Area's mean height-1200 feet.
